Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TLN-58 (TLN58; natural AMPs; alternatively cleaved form, human cathelicidin, primates, mammals, animals; UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: the lesion vesicle, human skin,Homo sapiens

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 65.5% similarity toALL-38. It is an alternative processed form of hCAP-18, the precursor of human LL-37 and ALL-38.Activity: Active against S. aureus, S. epidermidis, and Group A Streptococcus.Immune modulation: TLN-58 upregulated IL-17C, IL-8, IL-23, IL-1alpha, and IL-1beta mRNA and protein expression in normal human keratinocytes, similar to LL-37. Updated 6/2024
Literature Information.Author: Murakami M, Kameda K, Tsumoto H, Tsuda T, Masuda K, Utsunomiya R, Mori H, Miura Y, Sayama K. (2016 online)
Literature Information.Title: TLN-58, an additional hCAP18 processing form, found in the lesion vesicle of palmoplantar pustulosis in the skin.
